questions.question: Which stage of the Cyber Kill Chain involves gathering information about the target?
The 'Command and Control' phase of the Kill Chain allows an attacker to do what?
options: Send the exploit to the target

questions.question: Modifying the default OS configuration, removing unnecessary programs, and applying patches are all parts of:
What is the name of the Microsoft tool that scans for missing security updates, weak passwords, and security misconfigurations?
What is a 'service pack'?
options: A comprehensive update application that combines patches and upgrades
A tool for removing unnecessary services
A hardware device for secure communications
questions.answer: A comprehensive update application that combines patches and upgrades

questions.question: A software program that runs on a host computer to monitor for suspicious activity is called a:
What is the purpose of 'mutual authentication' (two-way authentication) in wireless security?
options: To encrypt the data between the client and the access point
To allow the access point to authenticate the client, and the client to authenticate the access point
To replace WEP and WPA standards
To ensure all users have the same shared key
questions.answer: To allow the access point to authenticate the client, and the client to authenticate the access point

questions.question: The security principle that limits folder or file access for a user to only what they need to perform their job is known as:
Which application 'freezes' a hard drive partition, reverting the system to its original configuration upon every restart?
An idle timer that automatically logs a user out and locks the screen after a specified period is a countermeasure against what?
options: A user leaving their workstation vulnerable and unattended
A user logging in outside of allowed hours
Malware being installed on a system
questions.answer: A user leaving their workstation vulnerable and unattended

questions.question: Which protocol provides a secure, encrypted management connection to a remote device and should replace Telnet?
What is a major security risk of the older Telnet protocol?
options: It is resource-intensive on the host
It uses unsecure plaintext transmission for logins and data
It requires a host-based firewall to function
It cannot be used for remote access
questions.answer: It uses unsecure plaintext transmission for logins and data

questions.question: What is the best-practice security measure for services running on a server?
options: Run all available services to ensure full functionality
Remove any unnecessary services to reduce the attack surface
Update services only when they cause a problem
questions.answer: Remove any unnecessary services to reduce the attack surface

questions.question: Which Windows Server feature allows an administrator to configure password and account lockout policies for large groups of users at once?
What is the primary function of a Network Operation Center (NOC)?
options: To monitor, assess, and defend against cybersecurity incidents
To provide a location for network troubleshooting, performance monitoring, and device management
To physically house all of an organization's servers and data
To manage and revoke user accounts and credentials
questions.answer: To provide a location for network troubleshooting, performance monitoring, and device management

questions.question: A dedicated site with a team of security analysts that monitors, detects, and responds to cybersecurity incidents is a:
What technology provides a way to group devices within a LAN using logical connections instead of physical ones?
One of the countermeasures listed for securing DHCP servers is:
options: Use Domain Name System Security Extensions (DNSSEC)
Close unused ports and uninstall unused services
questions.answer: Close unused ports and uninstall unused services

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a countermeasure for securing VoIP systems?
options: Using 'Open system authentication' for all phones
questions.answer: Using 'Open system authentication' for all phones

questions.question: Fences, security gates, and bollards are all examples of what type of security control?
